III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff provided a vape to a youth at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 5/22/2024 and
had no further information.
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 5/22/2024
and 6/12/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
2

Administrator reported Youth B informed her Youth A used Staff
1’s vape pen while on an outing to the movie Imaginary and Youth
A used a vape pen while on a community service outing.
Administrator did not have any further information as to where
Youth A would have received a vape pen while on the community
service outing. Administrator reported if Youth A would have used
a vape pen on the community service outing, she would believe it
would have been a community members vape pen as Youth B nor
Youth A alleged it came from a staff. Administrator was present at
the community service outing. Administrator reported she did not
see any vape pens laying around nor did she hear any concerns
of a vape pen being in access to any youth. Youth B verbalized
concerns to Administrator regarding Youth A having “something”
however it was unknown what it was believed Youth A had.
Administrator had Youth A shake out her clothing and patted
Youth A down to ensure she did not have anything on her. Youth
A did use the porta potty while at the community service outing. A
staff, unable to recall who, stood outside the porta potty. Youth A
was in the porta potty for approximately ten minutes as Youth A
reported she had a bowel movement. Administrator saw Youth A
after she used the porta potty and had no concerns regarding
Youth A being under the influence of anything or acting out of the
norm. Administrator has never seen or heard of any staff smoking
on facility grounds, including Staff 9. Administrator reported Staff
9 does not have any disciplines in her personnel file for anything
related to smoking on facility grounds. Administrator reported it is
against facility policy for staff to smoke on grounds. Administrator
reported Youth B’s medical and dental needs were met while
Youth B was placed at the facility. Youth B never had a diabetes
diagnosis while at the facility. Youth B’s mother was concerned
with Youth B’s weight gain at the facility however this concern was
addressed with Youth B’s mother.
Consultant was interviewed via telephone on 5/20/2024.
Consultant was at the facility when Youth B spoke with
Administrator privately. Administrator stepped into the kitchen
area and spoke with Youth B. Administrator came back and
informed Consultant that she would be calling in a complaint
based on information Youth B shared. Consultant initiated the
complaint onsite.
Youth A was interviewed via teams on 5/24/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she used
Staff 1’s vape pen at the movie theater on an outing to see
Imaginary. Staff 1 used her vape pen while walking into the movie
theater. During the movie, Youth A went to the bathroom with
3

Staff 2 and returned to her seat on the end of the isle. Staff 1 sat
on the opposite end of the row and went over to Youth A to ask
her a question. Youth A asked Staff 1 if she could hit her vape
pen. Staff 1 told Youth A she could and gave her the vape pen.
Youth A hid the vape pen in her sweatshirt sleeve and Staff 1
went back to her seat. Youth A used the vape pen three times in
the movie theater. Youth A reported it was a Breeze vape pen
however she did not recall the flavor of the vape. Youth A walked
back over to Staff 1 and gave the vape pen back. Youth A did not
recall who was sitting next to her in the movie theater. Youth A
reported no staff or youth saw her use the vape pen. Staff 1 told
Youth A not to tell anyone about her using Staff 1’s vape pen.
Youth A reported Staff 1 also let Youth E use her vape pen on a
separate occasion when Youth E and Staff 1 took the garbage out
to the dumpster. Youth E told Youth A about it. Youth A asked
Staff 1 and Staff 1 would not tell her if it was true. Youth A denied
vaping any other times at the facility or on facility outings,
including while completing community service. Youth A reported
there were cigarette butts on the ground at the facility near the
driveway. Youth A has seen new hires and staff smoking on
facility grounds however was not able to provide any names or
details.
Youth B was interviewed via teams on 5/28/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported Youth A
told her she hit Staff 1’s marijuana vape pen at the Imaginary
movie. Youth B did not see Youth A use the marijuana vape pen.
Youth A told Youth B she used Staff 1’s marijuana vape pen when
Staff 1 took Youth A to the bathroom. Youth B reported she
noticed Youth A and Staff 1 were gone for a long time in the
bathroom. Youth B reported she saw Staff 2 with a marijuana
vape pen at the Imaginary movie. Youth B reported Staff 2 was
using a red rectangular shaped marijuana vape pen during the
movie. Youth B was able to tell it was a marijuana vape pen as
she saw the oil inside the vape. There was no odor from the
marijuana pen. No youth used Staff 2’s marijuana vape pen.
Youth B reported she was sitting at one end of the movie theater
row next to Staff 1 and Staff 2 was sitting at the opposite end of
the row next to Youth A. Youth B did not see Staff 1 with a vape
pen or marijuana vape pen at the Imaginary movie. Youth B
reported she saw Staff 1 with a vape pen once at work as it was in
Staff 1’s pocket and almost fell out. Youth A told Youth B she
used a Breeze vape pen and Marijuana vape pen while doing
community service next door to Administrator’s house as
Administrator’s neighbors house had a fire. Youth B did not see
Youth A use a Breeze vape pen or marijuana vape pen. Youth A
4

told her she got the Breeze vape pen and marijuana vape pen
from a teenager who lived at the house where they were doing
community service. Youth A went into the porta potty and used
the Breeze vape pen and marijuana vape pen. Youth B reported
no staff were told about the incident or witnessed it. Youth A
acted different after using the porta potty as she was really hungry
and ate a lot of food. Youth B reported Youth E hit Staff 1’s vape
pen behind the garbage in January 2024. Youth B did not see
Youth E hit Staff 1’s vape pen however Youth E told her about it.
Youth E was upset and walked out of the facility and Staff 1
followed her. Youth E told Youth B Staff 1 offered her Breeze
vape pen to Youth E and Youth E used it. No other youth or staff
were outside with Youth E and Staff 1. Youth B was not aware of
any other youth using any other staff vape pens or marijuana vape
pens at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed via teams on 5/24/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported she did
not see any youth or staff use a vape when on an outing to the
movie theater. When on outings to the movie theater, youth have
to leave an empty seat in between one another. Youth C was not
sitting near Youth A. Youth C was unaware of any youth using
vape pens at the facility or any time on outings. Youth C has
never seen Staff 1 vape. Youth C reported there are cigarette
butts on the ground at the facility near the driveway area however
she has never seen any staff smoking.
Youth D was interviewed via teams on 5/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D went to see the
movie Imaginary with Staff 1, Staff 2, Youth B, and Youth C.
Youth D did not remember if Youth A attended the movie. Youth
D sat nearest to Staff 1 as Staff 1 sat in the seat nearest to the isle
and there was an empty seat and then Youth D. Youth D denied
ever seeing Staff 1 with a vape pen or marijuana vape pen at the
movies or any time at the facility. Youth D had no knowledge of
Staff 1 ever offering a vape pen or marijuana vape pen to any
youth at the facility. Youth D denied ever seeing Staff 2 have a
vape pen or marijuana vape pen at the movies or any time at the
facility. Youth D reported Staff 1 did not vape going into the movie
theater, Staff 1 only took Youth D to the bathroom during the
Imaginary movie. Staff 1 never walked down to talk to any youth at
the opposite end of the isle during the movie. Youth D never saw
Youth A or Youth E vape or use a marijuana vape pen at the
facility nor did she hear any youth claim to have. Youth D was on
the community service outing where there had been a house fire.
Youth F found a vape pen on the ground and gave it to the
5

homeowner. Youth B and Youth E made allegations Youth A had
a vape pen on her however Administrator checked Youth A and
Youth A did not. Youth D reported Youth A and Youth E tend to
lie. Youth D has never seen a vape pen laying on the ground at
the facility. Youth D did see an empty vape plastic container in an
outside garbage can after there was a new staff training. Youth D
reported there are cigarette butts in the parking lot and on the trail
to the gym however she has never witnessed any staff smoking
on facility grounds.
Youth E was interviewed via teams on 5/24/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported Staff 1
asked her in February if she wanted to use her vape pen when
Youth E and Staff 1 took garbage out to the dumpster. Youth E
declined Staff 1’s offer. Staff 1 used her vape pen while they were
at the dumpster. The vape pen was black and green and was a
Breeze Pro. Youth E reported there was nicotine in the vape pen.
There were no other staff or youth around when this occurred.
Youth E told Supervisor 1 about the incident in early March.
Supervisor 1 told Youth E to provide a written statement about the
incident which Youth E did. Youth E reported no other staff have
offered her a vape. Youth E did not know of any youth at the
facility using any vapes. Youth E had no knowledge of Youth A
using a vape pen while at the movies or at a community service
outing. Youth E reported there are cigarette butts on the trail to
Vassar House. Youth E has never seen any staff smoking on the
facility grounds.
Staff 1 was attempted to be interviewed face-to-face on
5/24/2024, via telephone on 6/5/2024, 6/6/2024, 6/12/2024, and
6/13/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 no
longer works at the facility and did not show up for the scheduled
face- to-face meeting on 5/24/2024 and never returned any
telephone calls.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams on 5/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she and
Staff 1 took Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D to see the movie
Imaginary. Staff 2 did not recall if there were any other youth who
attended. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 did not attend the movie. Staff
2 reported she sat at one end of the movie theater row and Staff 1
was at the opposite end with the youth in between them. Staff 2
did not remember if Staff 1 took Youth A to the bathroom during
the movie however if Staff 1 did take Youth A, she would have
taken another youth to maintain ratio. Staff 2 never saw Staff 1
use a vape pen at any time while at the movie or working at the
6

facility. Staff 2 never saw Staff 1 provide a vape pen to any of the
youth at the facility. Staff 1 never went down to Youth A during
the movie as Staff 1 reported Youth A was sitting in the middle of
the movie theater row. Staff 2 denied ever using a marijuana
vape pen at work. Staff 2 reported in new hire training staff are
informed vape pens are not allowed on facility grounds including
in staff vehicles. Staff 2 reported she does not use a vape pen
and would not have anything that resembles a red triangle vape
pen. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was a good staff, and she had no
concerns with Staff 1. Staff 2 denied ever seeing any staff
smoking on the facility grounds or any staff having vape pens.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams on 5/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 could not recall if he
attended the Imaginary movie. Staff 3 thought he may have with
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 3 could not recall which youth attended.
Staff 3 denied ever seeing Staff 1, Staff 2, or any youth use a
vape pen or marijuana vape pen at any movies he attended. Staff
3 reported no youth ever told him about using a staff’s vape pen or
marijuana vape pen. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 did not work much at
the facility as she frequently called in for her shifts. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 is a great staff, and he has no concerns with her.
Staff 3 reported he has never seen any staff smoking on the
facility grounds.
Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 were interviewed via
telephone on 6/5/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker
separately. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 were all at the
community service outing where it was alleged Youth A used a
vape pen. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 never saw Youth A
in possession of or use a vape pen while at the community service
outing or anytime at the facility. Staff 4 and Staff 5 had no
knowledge of Youth A using the porta potty at the community
service outing. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 all reported if
youth needed to use the porta potty, staff would take the youth
and stand outside the porta potty until the youth were done using
it. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 all reported they never saw
Staff 1 use a vape pen at work or offer a vape pen to any youth.
Staff 4, Staff 6, and Staff 7 never saw Staff 2 with a vape pen at
work. Staff 5 reported she saw Staff 2 with a vape pen once at
work as it was in Staff 2’s pocket when she arrived at work. Staff
2 realized the vape pen was in her pocket and took it out to her
car. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 never heard or saw Staff 2
offer a vape pen to any youth at the facility. Staff 5 reported there
was a vape pen on the floor at the community service outing that
belonged to the homeowner. Staff 5 did not recall if the vape pen
7

was picked up however reported she was aware that the vape pen
was returned to the lady it belonged to. Staff 6 reported she took
Youth A to use the porta potty and remained outside the porta
potty while Youth A was inside. Youth A was in the porta potty for
about five minutes. Staff 6 did not smell any odors coming from
the porta potty. Staff 6 and Staff 7 reported Youth A did not
appear to be under the influence of any substances at the
community service outing. Youth A ate tacos that were provided
after and did not eat anything more than the ordinary. Staff 4, Staff
6, and Staff 7 reported the facility is a smoke free area and have
never seen any staff smoking on facility grounds. Staff 5 reported
Staff 9 was smoking a cigarette in her car in the Vassar House
parking lot about a month ago when Staff 5 was taking Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth F to the gym. Staff 5 could smell the cigarette
smoke. Staff 5 notified Supervisor 2.
Staff 8 was interviewed via telephone on 6/6/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 8 was at the
community service outing. Staff 8 did not see Youth A with a vape
pen. Youth A went to the porta potty. Staff 6 remained outside
the porta potty while Youth A was inside. Staff 8 switched Staff 6
out while Youth A was in the porta potty and Staff 8 remained
outside the porta potty until Youth A was done using the
bathroom. Staff 8 reported Youth A did not appear under the
influence of any substances after using the porta potty. Staff 8 did
not see Youth A eat more than her normal after using the porta
potty. Staff 8 did not see anyone including staff, youth, or other
adults use a vape pen at the community service outing. Staff 8
reported a community member smoked a cigarette. Staff 8
reported she has never seen Staff 1 or Staff 2 use a vape pen,
have a vape pen at work, or offer a vape pen to any youth. Staff 8
has not seen any staff smoking on the facility grounds.
Staff 9 was interviewed via telephone on 6/13/2024. Staff 9
reported when she first started at the facility three months ago,
she did smoke in her car on facility grounds before learning in
orientation smoking is prohibited on facility grounds. Staff 9
reported she smoked twice in her car on break however now she
leaves off facility grounds to smoke. Staff 9 reported she was not
spoken to by any supervisors regarding when she smoked in her
car. Staff 9 has never seen cigarette butts on the ground around
the facility.
Case Manager was interviewed via teams on 5/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Case Manager reported
Youth A and Youth B were upset with one another at which time
8

Youth B reported Youth A used Staff 1’s vape. Youth A admitted
she used Staff 1’s vape pen after Youth B told Administrator. Case
Manager reported Youth E was upset with Staff 1 and filed a
grievance a few months ago, unsure date, regarding Staff 1
allowing Youth B to use a vape pen outside by the garbage can.
Youth A and Youth B told Case Manager Youth E was lying about
Staff 1. Case Manager reported Youth A told her she found a
marijuana vape pen when walking to the gym at the facility. Case
Manger reported an incident report was completed regarding this.
Youth A told Case Manager she threw the marijuana vape pen
away in the trash can near the gym. Youth A later changed her
story and told Case Manager she found the marijuana vape pen in
the parking lot at the movie theater. Youth A told Case Manager
the marijuana vape pen did not work however Youth A still
attempted to use it. Youth A was drug tested and she tested
negative for all substances. Case Manager reported Youth A
brought a lighter back to the facility after a home visit and stated
she wanted the lighter for cigarette butts she saw on the facility
grounds. Case Manager reported she has never seen any staff
smoking on facility grounds, in possession of a marijuana vape
pen, or a vape pen at the facility. Case Manager reported an
empty vape box was found in a garbage can at the facility one
time however she did not know who it belonged to.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via teams on 5/24/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 reported he
was unaware of any concerns regarding youth using staff’s vape
pens until Administrator informed him of the allegations of Youth A
using Staff 1’s vape pen. Supervisor 1 did not remember Youth E
telling him Staff 1 offered Youth E to use her vape pen.
Supervisor 1 did not remember asking Youth E to provide a
written statement. Supervisor 1 never saw Staff 1 use a vape pen
while at the facility or on any facility outings. Staff are not allowed
per company policy to smoke on the facility grounds. Supervisor 1
has never seen any staff smoke on facility grounds.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via teams on 6/13/2024.
Supervisor 2 reported no knowledge of any staff smoking on
facility grounds including Staff 9. Supervisor 2 reported he was
never told Staff 9 was smoking in her car on facility grounds.
Supervisor 2 reported it is against facility policy to smoke on
campus. Supervisor 2 has not seen any cigarette butts on the
ground around the facility.
9

Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services Incident Report dated
5/17/2024 for Youth A: Administrator was informed by
Youth B that Youth A used Staff 1’s vape pen at the movie
theater and used a vape at community service outing.
Youth A confirmed to Administrator she used Staff 1’s vape
pen at the movie theater and used a vape on the
community service outing.
• Wolverine Human Services Incident Report dated 4/4/2024
for Youth A: Youth A returned from a day pass with a
lighter. Youth A told Case Manager she found a marijuana
vape pen on the facility property and relapsed. Youth A
reported she found the marijuana vape pen on the ground
near the Vassar House sign while walking sometime
between January and February. Youth A used the
marijuana vape pen and got high from it. Youth A was drug
tested and was negative.
• Wolverine Human Services Promotion of Health and
Safety: All WHS buildings and properties are smoke free
environments.
• Wolverine Human Services Communication with Recipients
of Care Policy: Staff may not bring in any item to a recipient
of care (clients) that is not approved by your immediate
Supervisor 1.
• Quest Diagnostics Drug screen results for Youth A dated
5/14/2024: Youth A was negative for all substances.
• Grievance filed by Youth E regarding Staff 1 was
requested. The facility reported there was no grievance.
• Email from Emagine Entertainment dated 5/30/2024: Video
footage from the Imaginary movie on 3/26/2024 at 7:35pm
was reviewed and there was no footage found where a staff
handed a vape to a youth during the movie.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had no discipline in her
personnel file. Staff 1 received orientation training
1/5/2024. Staff 1 is no longer employed at the facility.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had one discipline in her
personnel file dated 4/2/2024 for bringing in food to the
facility and giving it to youth. Staff 2 received orientation
training 11/24/2023.
• Staff 9’s personnel file: Staff 9 had no discipline in her
personnel file related to smoking on facility grounds. Staff
10

9 received orientation training which included the facility
being a smoke free campus on 3/20/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Per staff and youth interviews,
Youth A indicated Staff 1 gave her a vape pen at the movies
however no other youth or staff witnessed this occur and the only
youth that had information pertaining to it was based on what they
had been told by Youth A. Youth A denied using a vape pen or
marijuana vape pen while on the community service outing and
there were no staff or youth who witnessed her use one. Youth B
reported Staff 2 used a marijuana vape pen at the movie however
there were no other staff or youth who witnessed this. Youth E
reported Staff 1 offered her to use Staff 1’s vape pen while taking
out the garbage. No staff or youth witnessed Staff 1 offer Youth E
a vape pen. In interviews it was reported there are cigarette butts
around the facility grounds however there is not enough
information to know where the cigarette butts are coming from as
there was only one staff who has reportedly witnessed Staff 9
smoking on facility grounds.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offer the facility immediately addresses
on day one of orientation that the facility and campus are smoke
free environments.
CONSULTATION ASSISTANCE:
Consultation was offered to retrain staff on the facilities no
smoking on facility grounds policy and random checks be
conducted to ensure cigarette butts are not on the facility grounds
in access to youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B did not receive routine medical and dental appointments
while placed at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
11

Youth B was interviewed via teams on 5/28/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported she was
not scheduled for routine medical or dental appointments when
she was at the facility from December 2023 to May 2024. Youth B
reported she has diabetes and did not receive routine
appointments to monitor her diabetes. Youth B reported she is
supposed to see the doctor every three months to monitor her
bloodwork. Youth B reported she had three medical appointments
while at the facility and blood work was completed however, she
never received the results of the blood work. Youth B reported she
did not receive a dental exam while at the facility.
Case Manager was interviewed via teams on 5/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Case Manager reported she
did not have any concerns with Youth B’s medical and/or dental
needs being met while Youth B was placed at the facility. Case
Manager reported Youth B was scheduled for a dental
appointment however Youth B refused to attend as she was not
feeling well. Youth B’s mother was contacted regarding Youth B’s
refusal to attend and agreed it was ok for Youth B not to attend
the dental appointment. Case Manager reported Youth B’s
mother had concerns about Youth B’s weight gain and requested
Youth B get tested for diabetes. The facility was taking the steps
to get Youth B tested and had an appointment scheduled with an
endocrinologist however Youth B was discharged from the facility
prior to this appointment occurring. Case Manager reported Youth
B did not have a diabetes diagnosis.
Probation Officer was interviewed via telephone on 5/28/2024.
Probation Officer reported she had no concerns with the facility
meeting Youth B’s medical and dental needs. Probation Officer
reported Youth B’s mother had concerns however the facility was
meeting Youth B’s medical and dental needs and any time
Probation Officer reached out to the facility regarding medical or
dental questions, the facility was on top of it.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth B’s Client Face Sheet: Youth B was placed at
Wolverine Services on 12/13/2023.
• Wolverine Human Services Health related resources,
procedures and oversight policy states all youth will receive
ongoing, coordinated services based on assessed needs
and goals. All clients will have a medical examination within
one year prior to or five days after admission, and annually
thereafter; and, all clients will have a dental screening upon
12

intake and a dental examination within six months to or one
month after admission, with appropriate follow up thereafter.
• Wayne County Initial History/Admission Physical Exam
dated 11/28/2024 for Youth B.
• Bay Region Medical Documentation for Youth B dated
12/24/2023: Youth B was seen due to self-harming
statements. Per the documentation, there is no diagnosis
listed to include diabetes.
• Quest Diagnostics Lab Results dated 1/11/2024 states
Youth B’s Hemoglobin ALC is 5.3 which is consistent with
the absence of diabetes.
• Great Lakes Bay Health Centers well child exam report for
Youth B dated 1/29/2024.
• Wolverine Human Services Psychiatric Evaluation Update
and Medication Reviews dates 12/19/2023, 2/7/2024,
2/20/2024, 3/19/2024, and 4/16/2024.
• Covenant HealthCare for Youth B dated 3/18/2024: Youth
B was seen for right hand pain due to punching a wall.
• Covenant HealthCare for Youth B dated 4/9/2024: Youth B
was seen for mental health evaluation.
• Quest Diagnostics Lab Results dated 5/15/2024 states
Youth B’s Hemoglobin ALC is 5.9 which is consistent with
prediabetes and should be confirmed with a follow-up test.
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility Dental Screening
for Youth B dated 11/16/2023.
• Needs and Strengths Assessment for Youth B dated
5/21/2024: Youth B was compliant with her daily hygiene
schedule. Youth B was compliant with her prescribed
medications. Youth B had access to medical complaint
